adrFormatAddress: 3227 Broadway, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text: The crispy fried chicken is delicious. The biscuit was flaky though didn't crumble into nothing. The honey and butter pickles are nice flavor and don't add an overwhelmingly sweetness. Overall the flavor combinations are balanced and delicious. The chicken was crunchy but round so there were bites without chicken (a little flatter might spread out the bites). It was cooked fresh taking a little longer than expected, they should let you know in advance. I'd go back.

text.text: The crispy fried chicken is delicious. The biscuit was flaky though didn't crumble into nothing. The honey and butter pickles are nice flavor and don't add an overwhelmingly sweetness. It was cooked fresh taking a little longer than expected, they should let you know in advance. I'd go back.

originalText.text:
Yes, the biscuits are the best, but don't let that stop you from getting the chicken and corn soup - which was exceptional. The flavor in the broth was so well developed and the consistency was perfect - not to thick, not to thin, just right. The mini-biscuit that came with it was perfect. We chose the apple butter spread which was great, but I'm looking forward to another visit to try the strawberry and blueberry preserves.
We also had the fried chicken biscuit which was incredibly flavorful. There were tons of pickles and a good spread of really delicious pimento cheese. The chicken was simply the best. The avocado biscuit rounded out our sharables and was also delicious - I love avocado and a runny egg, but the tomato jam was the star of this dish.
Chef Chris Scott has created simply excellent food and if you're in the area and haven't been, then make it happen. You're missing out.

Chef Chris Scott has created simply excellent food and if you're in the area and haven't been, then make it happen. You're missing out.

originalText.text:
These are by far the most amazing biscuits I have ever tasted, Chef Chris Scott is a biscuit king! I had the sausage and cheddar biscuit sandwich- the biscuit is huge, thick and flaky and the sausage is so delicious and fresh- not frozen, dried up patties you often get in other restaurants. Treated my coworkers to biscuits, they couldn't stop raving- no crumbs were left behind! And previously I've also had the buttermilk fried potatoes, so good you'll never go back to hash browns or home fries again! Portions are huge. Delivery was also early and my order was still hot when it arrived.

Also the history behind him becoming a chef and his recipes are fascinating!

The new venue in Manhattanville Market is beautiful with 4 other restaurants as well, definitely check it out!

originalText.text: I don't know if I ordered on an off day or their oven was on the fritz but these biscuits were pretty bad.  They were dry and overcooked on the outside and gooey on the inside.  They were obviously cooked at too high a temperature.

originalText.text: The biscuit is amazing! You can go wrong with any toppings but the biscuit is the star of the show! I also had the cinnamon roll and it was dreamy!
